Description: An ORM is chosen, or a decision not to use one is made.
The structure is automatically created and/or migrated.
Database can be seeded, using the YML fixtures in the "rails" example (as a baseline).
All columns that should not be null are generated as "not null" in the database.
Uses UUID as primary key of tables.
Relations (belongs-to, has-many, has-one) are established in the ORM.
Database enumerations are used (instead of plain strings).
